With all the colorful lanterns displayed for #LunarNewYear celebration @kencen, I wish you a very happy and prosperous Year of the Tiger. https://t.co/Vsp6To4VRx
It's not easy, and it will take time. There will be a lot of difficulties. My role is to make this road less difficult, less painful, and more certain.

The road ahead is bumpy. Both countries are in the process of rediscovering each other and finding an appropriate way to get along. A good relationship has to be based on mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation.

No conflict, no war is the biggest consensus between China & the US. The Taiwan separatist forces will most likely involve China and the United States in a military conflict. Let's work together to contain them, to give peace a chance. Let peace prevail.
The goal of China's policy in Xinjiang is to make the society stable and safe, to make people without fear, without hate, that people from all ethnic groups live peacefully and calmly.

Over the past 40 years, the Uyghur population rose from 5.5 million to 11 million, more than doubled. The average life expectancy of Xinjiang people in the past 60 years has increased from 30 to 72. Have you seen genocide in the world like this?

The government has many channels to solicit opinions from the people, including criticism. Every major policy, before published, is made public for comments. Among them are criticisms & complaints. The government listens to & considers them, and corrects them if anything is wrong

We regulate the Internet according to law and in the interests of the general public. On the one hand, we let people get access to different information. On the other hand, we bear in mind the general interests of the public.

We are welcoming Beijing Winter Olympics. Beijing is ready. All the venues, stadiums, facilities are in perfect conditions. Organizing & operating work is well on the way. 2,000 athletes are ready. A quarantine closed loop is in place to protect all stakeholders.

The traditional food for this day is Laba porridge, made with various grains and dried fruits.

text:

-A nuclear war cannot be won & must never be fought.

urls.title: Russian and Chinese Ambassadors: Respecting People’s Democratic Rights
urls.description: The upcoming American-led online Summit for Democracy will stoke ideological confrontation. Faced with an array of global challenges, countries urgently need to strengthen coordination and

text: Read my joint opinion piece with Russian Ambassador Anatoly Antonov on calling for due respect for people's democratic rights. https://t.co/UteZitpfY7

The Summit for #Democracy is an evident product of Cold-War mentality. It will stoke up ideological confrontation and a rift in the world, creating new “dividing lines.” This trend contradicts the development of the modern world.

Today, the big ball of China-US relations still needs the small ping pong ball to move it forward, from which we see the strategic vision, political courage and people’s friendship reflected in Ping-Pong Diplomacy.

We do sometimes compete, but we should follow the recognized rules like table tennis players, have fair and healthy competition, respect each other, appreciate each other, learn from each other, and make progress together.

President Xi also pointed out, “the most important event in international relations in the coming 50 years will be for China & the US to find the right way to get along.” I hope that our two peoples will know more about #PingPongDiplomacy and learn from history.

As President Xi pointed out during his virtual meeting with President Biden, "the most important event in international relations over the past 50 years was the reopening and development of China-US relations." This most important event started from a small ping pong ball. https://t.co/4yecuURAra

Spoke at the Commemoration of the 50th Anniversary of #PingPongDiplomacy cohosted by @NCUSCR, USATT and CTTA on the first day of 2021 World Table Tennis Championships in Houston. https://t.co/S8ttqryY65   https://t.co/U6oXzQerdz

50 years after “Ping Pong Diplomacy", Chinese and US Ping Pong players are teaming up for mixed doubles at World Table Tennis Championships in Houston. Wish them good luck in the coming games. https://t.co/M9mYyccn66

Constructive talks with Assistant Secretary of State Daniel Kritenbrink on China-US relations and steps to implement the spirit and consensus of the recent virtual meeting between President Xi Jinping and President Joe Biden.

Shocked & dismayed by the murder of Chinese student Zheng Shaoxiong in Chicago. My deep condolences to his parents. Chinese Consulate General in Chicago is helping them deal with the aftermath. We call for justice in his case & protection of Chinese in US from hatred & xenophobia

On Taiwan, if the US wants to safeguard peace across Taiwan Strait, it should clearly &resolutely oppose "Taiwan independence" moves, keep the commitments in the three joint communiques, put one-China policy into action & stop sending wrong signals to "Taiwan independence" forces

勿忘昨天的苦难辉煌，无愧今天的使命担当，不负明天的伟大梦想，为实现第二个百年奋斗目标、实现中华民族伟大复兴的中国梦而不懈奋斗。
全党必须永远保持同人民群众的血肉联系，践行以人民为中心的发展思想，不断实现好、维护好、发展好最广大人民根本利益，团结带领全国各族人民不断为美好生活而奋斗。
牢记中国共产党是什么、要干什么这个根本问题，把握历史发展大势，坚定理想信念，牢记初心使命，始终谦虚谨慎、不骄不躁、艰苦奋斗，不为任何风险所惧，不为任何干扰所惑，决不在根本性问题上出现颠覆性错误，以咬定青山不放松的执着奋力实现既定目标，以行百里者半九十的清醒不懈推进中华民族伟大复兴
全会指出了中国共产党百年奋斗的历史意义：党的百年奋斗从根本上改变了中国人民的前途命运；党的百年奋斗开辟了实现中华民族伟大复兴的正确道路；党的百年奋斗展示了马克思主义的强大生命力；党的百年奋斗深刻影响了世界历史进程；党的百年奋斗锻造了走在时代前列的中国共产党。
中国共产党成立以来，始终把为中国人民谋幸福、为中华民族谋复兴作为自己的初心使命，始终坚持共产主义理想和社会主义信念，团结带领全国各族人民为争取民族独立、人民解放和实现国家富强、人民幸福而不懈奋斗，已经走过一百年光辉历程。党和人民百年奋斗，书写了中华民族几千年历史上最恢宏的史诗。
中国共产党第十九届中央委员会第六次全体会议，于2021年11月8日至11日在北京举行。全会公报指出，我们要从党的百年奋斗中看清楚过去我们为什么能够成功、弄明白未来我们怎样才能继续成功，从而更加坚定、更加自觉地践行初心使命，在新时代更好坚持和发展中国特色社会主义。

What is China’s traditional virtue? It means a concern for the common good of humanity. To quote a Chinese poem, “how wonderful it would be if there could be tens of thousands of houses to shelter those in need, together in joy!”

These buzzwords reflect the changing & unchanging elements in our values amidst rapid economic growth & profound social changes. We need to keep fine traditional values, uphold fairness and justice, and not get lost in a market economy.

Sixth, double reduction. This is a recent policy to address involution in education. It is designed to ensure education will return to its original purpose, children can have all-round development in school, and personal growth will be considered more important than success.
Fifth, involution. It means irrational or involuntary competition. Because of it, people feel burned out, and individual efforts are made less worthwhile.

Fourth, Versailles, originally from the Palace of Versailles in France. On social media, it is used to label humble-braggers, who pretend to sound modest when they flaunt their rich and unique lifestyle.
Third, lie flat, which describes the youngsters who give up ambitions and do the bare minimum to get by.

Second, heroes in harm’s way, which refers to the everyday heroes who put their mission before their lives and made fearless sacrifices to fight the pandemic. They held on to their posts day and night to keep people’s daily life up and running at a special time.

The first #buzzword I shared with the audience yesterday was people first, life first. It's rooted in Chinese history and reflects a deep concern for humanity. Putting people at the center is a guiding principle of the CPC & a core value of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

China’s Confucian classic The Book of Rites writes, “If you can make yourself anew for one day, do so every day, and keep on doing it forever for improvement.” Let's be innovative and forward-looking, and take new bold steps together.

China and the US can advance coordination and cooperation on climate change, COVID-19 response and economic recovery. These areas are innovation intensive. The US side also needs to create conditions, instead of barriers, for our cooperation.

The Chinese never believe in “Thucydides trap”. We will open a path of national renaissance & peaceful development. We call on the US to uphold peaceful dvpt, abandon wrong thinking, and work with China to find a way of getting along based on mutual respect & win-win cooperation.

Mankind is a community with a shared future. No country can solve the world’s difficulties and challenges alone, and no country can stand aloof from them. China and the US need to show broad vision and shoulder great responsibilities.
For China-US relations, innovation is a “golden key” to some thorny issues. We need a new vision, new thinking and new methodology.

China's high-quality development will be empowered, first and foremost, by innovation. Innovation is at the core of China’s overall development, and comes the first in the new development philosophy: innovative, coordinated, green, open and shared development.
“New” is the mother of innovation, which takes mankind forward. https://t.co/sdS11ahdsA

Had a good talk at Bloomberg New Economy Forum meeting. “New” is the mother of innovation, which takes mankind forward. Hope that we will explore new solutions to global challenges, look for new ways to spur post-pandemic recovery, and tap new potential of China-US cooperation. https://t.co/pH8qY8P8um

There is only one int'l system, i.e. the system with the UN at its core. There is only one int'l order, i.e. the order underpinned by int'l law. There is only one set of rules, i.e. the basic norms governing int'l relations underpinned by the purposes & principles of UN Charter.

One country’s success does not have to mean another country’s failure. We need to pursue dialogue and inclusiveness over confrontation and exclusion. China has never and will never invade or bully others, or seek hegemony.
Democracy is not a special right reserved to an individual country, but a right for the people of all countries to enjoy.

China has pledged an additional three billion US dollars of international assistance in the next three years to support developing countries in responding to COVID-19 and promoting economic and social recovery.
China will step up support for other developing countries in developing green and low-carbon energy, and will not build new coal-fired power projects abroad.

We should care about special needs of developing countries. We may employ such means as debt suspension & dvpt aid to help developing countries, esp. vulnerable ones facing exceptional difficulties, focusing on addressing unbalanced & inadequate dvpt among & within countries.

President Xi at UNGA: We should safeguard and improve people’s livelihoods and protect and promote human rights through development, and make sure that development is for the people and by the people, and that its fruits are shared among the people.
China has put forward a Global Digital Security Initiative. We welcome the response from the US side, so that we can jointly maintain global digital and cyber security.

If a country likes to talk about safeguarding a rules-based international order, but does not follow the rules set by itself, or only follows them selectively, or keeps flip-flopping, how can you expect other countries to trust this country?
On climate change, China and the US must first do their own things well. We must honor our words with real actions.

There isn’t any example in the history of international relations where the political relationship between two countries is in competition or even confrontation but other spheres remain safe and sound.

What I worry about is that the US uses competition to define China-US relations, while competition on the US side often means confrontation, esp. on issues concerning China’s core interests. If this doesn't change, it will hurt our efforts for mutual trust & cooperation.
We hope that the US side will lift the iron curtain between our people, and allow our students, scholars, scientists and artists to talk and work together without fear and obstacles.

China is applying to join the CPTPP, which will inject strong impetus into regional economic integration of the Asia-Pacific, boost trade and investment, and promote development and prosperity of this region.

China is a powerhouse & source of confidence for Asian & world economy and trade, and a strong link of global supply chain. It's striving towards common prosperity, and committed to high-level opening-up. This means a broader market & greater opportunities for Asian countries.
Security affairs of the Asia-Pacific should be jointly decided by people in the region, and not be dominated by the Anglo-Saxons.

China is open & inclusive. We welcome & accept suggestions or criticisms, as long as they're objective, truthful, well-intentioned & constructive. But we don't accept slander, disinformation, bossy preaching, or words & deeds hurting China's sovereignty & territorial integrity.

China and the US should not and cannot change each other. Instead, we should break ideological barriers, discard zero-sum mentality, respect other countries, and accommodate each other without losing our own distinctions, so as to get along with each other in peace.
We never say that our system is the best, because we know only the suited is the best. Whether it is good or not should not be judged by what we say, but what we do.

China is just pursuing peace, development, fairness, justice, democracy and freedom, which are common values of mankind. Both China’s people-centered philosophy and President Lincoln’s “of the people, by the people, for the people” are for the sake of the people.

China is not perfect. There are many difficulties & challenges on our way. But we are deepening reform, improving socialist democracy, and modernizing national governance. These efforts are to meet the people’s aspiration for a better life & make greater contribution to mankind.

A Harvard Kennedy School survey shows the Chinese people’s satisfaction of the CPC has been over 90% for 10 years. Changchun has had a Mayor’s Hotline for 22 years, and people’s satisfaction has remained 90+%. If you know about it, is it hard to understand the survey results?
Whether a system is democratic depends on whether it can represent the overall interests of the people and whether the people are satisfied. Democracy is not for embellishment; it should deliver.
Officials who are incompetent, not clean, or disapproved by the people have no chance to be promoted. This is why China’s senior officials can be elected overwhelmingly or even unanimously.
A Chinese has to receive all kinds of trainings, assessments , selections & oversight in his/her lifetime. CPC members are also subject to Party disciplines, which are stricter than the law.

There are seldom fierce arguments or long-pending bills in people’s congresses in China, because most of the problems and conflicts of interests have been resolved and suggestions accepted in consultations, which also make implementation of the policies easier.

In the public consultations for the 14th Five-Year Plan, 1,000+ suggestions were summarized from 1 million+ online posts, and 366 edits were made to the draft. After the deliberations by the NPC and the CPPCC, another 55 adjustments were made before the adoption of the Plan.
When drafting the Civil Code, there had been ten rounds of collection of public opinions, and over one million opinions were gathered from more than 420,000 people.

What China has today is whole-process democracy. All major legislations and decisions are made through scientific and democratic processes and extensive consultations, to make sure what the people want are reflected in the final decisions.

The idea of people first has been deep in the genes of the Chinese. Confucius raised the idea that people are the foundation of a country. The founding mission of the CPC is to pursue happiness for the people, and it serves the people whole-heartedly.

In Plato's theory of education, people who have survived all the trials and tribulations no long engage in empty talk, and they become determined and experienced. So they would be put on governing positions.
Whatever political system a country chooses, its purpose is to select appropriate persons to govern the country and create a better life for the people.

A basic criterion of democracy should be whether the people have the right to govern their country, whether their needs are met, and whether they have a sense of fulfillment and happiness. At the center of democracy is people.

Some Americans try to define America’s relations with China as democracy versus authoritarianism, and to stoke up ideological confrontation, which has led to serious difficulties in China-US relations.

Had a conversation with @CarterCenter & @GHWBushChina on democracy. It's wrong to define China-US relations as democracy vs authoritarianism. What China has is whole-process democracy: from the people, to the people, with the people, for the people. https://t.co/LMtCrV8hzn https://t.co/FzbxTA4QuD

China has pledged an additional three billion US dollars of international assistance in the next three years to support developing countries in responding to COVID-19 and promoting economic and social recovery.
China will continue to support and engage in global science-based origins tracing, and stands firmly opposed to political maneuvering in whatever form.

Ensuring fair & equitable distribution of vaccines globally is imperative. China will strive to provide 2 billion doses of vaccines to the world by end of 2021. Besides donating $100 Mln to COVAX, China will donate 100 Mln doses of vaccines to other developing countries in 2021.

President Xi: We must beat COVID-19 & win this decisive fight crucial to the future of humanity. We should put people & their lives first, care about life, value & dignity of every individual. We need to respect science, take a science-based approach & follow the laws of science.

As Chinese Ambassador to the US, I will be a good listener and helper to the American business community, so that we can uphold and promote the common interests of China and the US.

Neither Section 301 investigations nor tariff war has worked. It is hoped that necessary conditions and atmosphere can be created for the implementation of the phase one agreement and bilateral economic and trade exchanges, rather than making things worse.

On concerns about the uncertainties in China-US relations, what I can offer is the certainty from the Chinese side. China’s economy is promising, its market potential is huge, and its door of opening-up will only open wider.

If we compare China-US relations to a giant ship, then economic and trade cooperation has been its ballast and propeller. When the ship sails against heavy winds and huge waves, we need to add more strength to the ballast and propeller.

Reform and opening-up is just like crossing the river by feeling the stones. When new problems occur, we must try to resolve them with new solutions. We will create a fair and law-based market environment, and make our policies more predictable.

China's economy enjoys a good  momentum & bright prospects. It will remain the source of confidence, growth and hope for world economic recovery in the post-pandemic era, and will provide vast market and great opportunities for foreign investors, including American ones.

We should not miss historical opportunities. More importantly, we should not make historical mistakes. As two major countries with different political systems, cultures & development stages, we must find a way to get along in peace based on mutual respect.

In the ongoing Tokyo #Paralympic Games, Chinese athletes are well leading the medal tally. This is because after all the historical ups and downs, the Chinese people would always strive for self-perfection even in hardships.

China knows how it feels to be cornered, just like today when we face the threat of cutting off supplies. But we have all made it through. When the US uses state power to suppress Huawei, it shouldn't expect the collapse of Huawei, but the emerging of more companies like Huawei.
China is not the Soviet Union. The Soviet Union’s collapse was its own making. China has learned from this part of history that hegemonism will only lead to decline.

China is committed to peaceful development and a community with a shared future for mankind. It's absurd & dangerous to apply the “Cold War playbook” to today’s China-US relations, and take China as its rival and imaginary enemy, just like when Don Quixote tilted at windmills.
Some people believe that China is betting against America, and China’s goal is to challenge and displace America. This is a serious misjudgment of China’s strategic intention.
